ygData.subject: Re: Archery
ygData.msgSnippet:
No, you arent the only one who thinks this.  But what you may not have 
realized is that I, like several other paladins, use archery as a sport. 
 It requires
ygData.messageBody:
No, you arent the only one who thinks this. But what you may not have
realized is that I, like several other paladins, use archery as a sport.
It requires a keen eye and a steady hand in order to thit the mark and its
quite satifying to do so. I really only use my bow to play and take hunt
small game. Have you every chased a deer with your sword. :)

But of course, when its time to battle, i put away my bow and bring out the
sword. I never entire a battle without being the first in to swing.

On Tuesday, June 01, 1999 1:01 AM, Juha Palomaa (ECS)
[SMTP:juha.palomaa@...] wrote:
> From: "Juha Palomaa (ECS)" <juha.palomaa@...>
>
> Hail,
>
> Am I the only one that thinks archery is a non paladin like skill ?
> I for one cant understand why they gave us this covardly backstabbing
skill.
>
> Nothing is better than a charge into a camp filled with filthy orcs !
>
> / Njelm, crusader of Kaladim
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Kevin Byer [SMTP:kbyer@...]
> > Sent: den 31 maj 1999 21:01
> > To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
> > Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Archery
> >
> > From: Kevin Byer <kbyer@...>
> >
> > is there a place near freeport that fletchers can get their parts from,
its
> > a long trip to other cities. I am a budding fletcher(average skill) and
I
> > hate having to travel every couple of days for materials.
> >
> > Also what are the pine needles and tiny daggers for?
> >
> > Aban
> >
> > On Monday, May 31, 1999 12:53 PM, RangerDest@...
> > [SMTP:RangerDest@...] wrote:
> > > From: RangerDest@...
> > >
> > > Ask a fletcher to make a rouge elm bow for you. Mine is 13 dmg 50
> > > delay 75 range and I bought it for 5 pp. Most fletchers seem to be in
> > Greater
> > > Faydark
> > >
> > > Oh and I talked to GM and he said that since paladins have the
> > > archery skill they MIGHT be able to use tiny dagger and pine needles
in
> > the
> > > next patch, but that we should all send Feedbacks to the GMs so that
it
> > gets
> > > on the "list" of things to do. I have already done so and I urge the
> > rest of
> > > you to do it as well, whether you use a bow or not.
> > >
> > > -Adaron
> > >
